reference-code.description: Other assistance - SSD staff or College Board will confirm
Four-function calculator on SAT Math Test - No Calculator section

custom-fields.custom-field: Paper-based edition of the grades 3?8 ELA or Mathematics test may be administered as an accommodation for a student who is unable to use a computer or take the computer-based test due to a disability.

Scribe responses for the Mathematics tests using a human scribe who will record the student's responses verbatim, either onscreen (computer-based test) or in the student's answer booklet (paper-based test), as dictated by the student at the time of testing. The student must be tested in a separate setting.

Scribe responses for the Mathematics tests using a speech-to-text or other external augmentative communications device (other than a smartphone) to dictate or generate responses, under the direct supervision of a test administrator. The test administrator must transcribe the student's responses verbatim (either onscreen or in student's answer booklet) any time prior to the end of the testing window. The student must be tested in a separate setting.

reference-code.code: A11 Answers Recorded in Test Booklet
reference-code.description: Answers Recorded in Test Booklet (paper based only)

custom-fields.custom-field: Responses recorded by student in test booklet, rather than in the answer booklet. Responses must be transcribed by a test administrator into the student's answer booklet. If the student transcribes his or her own responses, then transcription must occur during the test session and be completed on the day in which the test session began.

Responses must be printed out, one response per page, and inserted in the student's answer booklet with all required information on each page. No transcription is necessary. After printing out, responses must be deleted from word processor or device.

Student records responses on an external recording device (other than a smartphone) while reading the test aloud, then transcribes responses into the answer booklet while playing back recorded segment(s). Responses must be deleted from the device once transcription is completed.

reference-code.description: Responses Signed onto Video for Student who is Deaf or Hard-of Hearing

custom-fields.custom-field: Responses signed onto video (for a student who is Deaf or Hard-of Hearing), then transcribed by the student onscreen or into the answer booklet during playback. The video must be deleted after transcription.
Monitor placement of responses in the appropriate area onscreen or in the answer booklet by the test administrator

Computer-Based Test Refreshable Braille Display/Braille note-taker (specific external device used in conjunction with screen reader. A hard-copy edition of the Braille test should also be ordered.)
Paper-Based Test Braille note-taker (specific external device used in conjunction with hard-copy Braille test)

Computer-Based Test Braille writer (specific external device used in conjunction with screen reader and hard-copy Braille test)
Paper-Based Test Braille writer (specific external device used in conjunction with the hard-copy Braille test)
Large print edition (approximately 18-point font size on 11x17-inch paper)
Screen reader for a student who is blind or visually impaired
Braille edition (hard copy) All answers must be either scribed or transcribed verbatim into the student's answer booklet in order for the student to receive credit for his or her work.
Text-to-speech (TTS) computer-based read-aloud mathematics tests
The test must be read word-for-word, exactly as it appears.

Human signer for the Mathematics and ELA test questions only (not reading passages) for a student who is Deaf or Hard-of-Hearing (computer- and paper-based tests): The test must be signed exactly as it appears.

reference-code.code: A7 Human Signer for Test Directions Only
reference-code.description: Human Signer for Test Directions Only

custom-fields.custom-field: Human signer for test directions only for a student who is Deaf or Hard-of-Hearing
Track test items (i.e., helping the student move from one test question to the next)

A student may use no more than two different pre-approved graphic organizers or supplemental reference sheets per test session. Graphic organizers may be used throughout the school year during instruction.

reference-code.code: ASL Video for the Mathematics Assessments
reference-code.description: ASL Video for the Mathematics Assessments for a Student Who is Deaf or Hard of Hearing
ASL Video of Test Directions for a Student Who is Deaf or Hard of Hearing
Abacus use for student with severe visual impairment or blindness (Mathematics and Science)

reference-code.code: Adaptive and specialized equipment or furniture
reference-code.description: Adaptive and specialized equipment or furniture

reference-code.code: Administer test with other school personnel
reference-code.description: Administer the test with other school personnel known to the student

reference-code.code: Administer test with special ed. personnel
reference-code.description: Administer the test with special education personnel

reference-code.code: Administrator Reads Aloud - Lang, Lit, Reading
Administrator Signs Test - Lang, Lit, Reading
Auditory amplification device or noise buffers
reference-code.description: Auditory amplification device or noise buffers
Blank Scratch Paper (including blank, lined or graph paper)

reference-code.code: Braille Edition of ELA/Literacy and Math
reference-code.description: Braille Edition of ELA/Literacy and Mathematics Assessments
Auditory amplification device or noise buffers
Student reads test aloud to self
Reduction of visual print by blocking or other techniques
Calculation Device and Mathematics Tools (on Non-calculator Sessions of Mathematics Assessments)

reference-code.code: Calculator on Sess. 1 - Math or Sess. 3 - Science
reference-code.description: Using calculator on Sess. 1 of the Math Test or scientific calculator on Sess. 3 of the Science Test
Closed-Captioning of Multimedia Passages on the ELA/Literacy Assessments11

custom-fields.custom-field: Small group test administration (May include up to a total of 10 students.)
"Stop Testing" policy: If a student does not appear to be responding to test questions after a period of 15-20 minutes, the test administrator may ask if the student is finished.
Individual (one-to-one) test administration (Student must be tested in a separate setting.)

reference-code.code: DF4 Separate or Alternate Test Location
DF5 Seating in Specific Area of Testing Location
reference-code.description: Seating in Specific Area of Testing Location

custom-fields.custom-field: Seating in a specific area of the testing room, including the use of a study carrel
Adaptive or specialized furniture (seating, desk, or lighting)

reference-code.code: DF7 Noise Buffer or Noise Cancelling Headphones
reference-code.description: Noise Buffer or Noise Cancelling Headphones

custom-fields.custom-field: Noise buffer or noise-cancelling earmuffs/headphones may be used only after the test administration instructions have been read to student. Music or other recordings may not be played on headphones worn during testing.

reference-code.code: DF9 Student Reads Test Aloud to Self
reference-code.description: Student Reads Test Aloud to Self

custom-fields.custom-field: Student reads test aloud to self (Student must be tested in a separate setting.)

reference-code.code: EL2 Approved Bilingual Word to Word Dictionary
reference-code.description: Approved Bilingual Word to Word Dictionary

reference-code.code: EL3.1 Text to Speech in English (Math Test)
reference-code.description: Text to Speech in English (Math Test)

custom-fields.custom-field: Text-to-speech for Mathematics tests only If administering the paper-based test with a human reader, the test must be read word for word in English, exactly as written. f not using headphones, then student must be tested in a separate setting.

reference-code.code: EL3.2 Human Read Aloud in English (Math test)
reference-code.description: Human Read Aloud in English (Math test)

custom-fields.custom-field: Human read-aloud for Mathematics tests in English If a human reader is used, the test must be administered in a separate setting either individually or to a group of 2-5 students all of whom are receiving the human reader accommodation.

reference-code.code: EL3.3 Human Read Aloud in Spanish (Math test)
reference-code.description: Human Read Aloud in Spanish (Math test)

custom-fields.custom-field: Human read-aloud in Spanish for Mathematics tests only The entire test must be read word for word in Spanish, exactly as written. The test must be administered in a separate setting either individually or to a group of 2-5 students all of whom are receiving the human reader in Spanish accommodation. The person reading the test must be fluent in reading, writing, and speaking Spanish.
Scribe for the Mathematics tests only, using EL4.1: a human scribe records student's responses verbatim at the time of testing;

reference-code.code: EL4.2 Scribe Student Dictates Response (Math Test)

custom-fields.custom-field: Scribe for the Mathematics tests only, using EL4.2: student dictates responses using speech-to-text or other external communication device, with subsequent transcription by an adult, either onscreen or in the student's answer booklet.

reference-code.code: EL5 Directions Provided in Student Native Language
reference-code.description: Directions Provided in Student Native Language

custom-fields.custom-field: Read aloud/repeat/clarify general administration directions in student's native language, including Spanish.

Spanish Edition of the grades 3-8 Mathematics tests may be administered to any EL student with a low level of English proficiency, is currently receiving or has received mathematics instruction in Spanish, or who has little or no familiarity with technology.

reference-code.code: EL7 Spanish Edition Math Test (Paper Based)

custom-fields.custom-field: Paper-based edition in Spanish of the grades 3-8 Mathematics tests may be administered to any EL student with a low level of English proficiency, is currently receiving or has received mathematics instruction in Spanish, or who has little or no familiarity with technology.

reference-code.code: EL8 Spanish Ed Math Test (Large Print)

custom-fields.custom-field: Large Print paper-based edition in Spanish of the grades 3-8 Mathematics (approximately 18-point font size on 11x17-inch paper) tests may be administered to any EL student with a low level of English proficiency, is currently receiving or has received mathematics instruction in Spanish, has a visual impairment, or who has little or no familiarity with technology.

reference-code.code: ELA Constructed Resp Human Signer ELA
ELA Constructed Response Speech to Text
ELA Selected Response Speech to Text
Electronic Text Reader - Lang, Lit, Reading

reference-code.description: Allow extended time until in the admin's judgement the student can no longer sustain the activity

with test and directions read aloud in English or signed to the student. (NOT allowed for the Readin
with only test directions read aloud or signed to the student.
with administrator verification of student understanding following the reading of test directions.
by trained school personnel known to the student other than the student's classroom teacher.
using a large-print version of assessment.

reference-code.code: Paper-and-Pencil Ed. of ELA/Lit and Math Assess
reference-code.description: Paper-and-Pencil Edition of the ELA/Literacy and Mathematics Assessments
with a student dictating responses to school personnel. (NOT allowed for the Writing test. See O2 -
with a student dictating responses using alternative or assistive technology/devices that are part o
with a student using approved tools or devices to minimize distractions.
with a student writing responses using separate paper, a word processer, computer, brailler, or simi
with a student indicating responses to multiple-choice items to school personnel.
with a student responding with the use of visual aids.
Reduction of visual print by blocking or other techniques
in a separate location within the school by trained school personnel.

custom-fields.custom-field: Human Signer for ELA reading passages for a student who is Deaf or Hard-of-Hearing The student must meet all of the following criteria: be virtually unable to read, even after varied and repeated attempts to teach the student to do so (i.e., the student is at the very beginning stages of learning to read, and not simply reading below grade level), due to a documented disability and/or history of early and prolonged lack of exposure to and use of language; and uses this accommodation routinely, except during reading instruction; and receives ongoing intervention to learn the skill. Small groups have between five and ten students.

Scribe responses on the ELA test, using a human scribe records student's responses verbatim during testing into TestNav directly or the student's answer booklet.The student may make edits independently or may direct the scribe to make the edits. The scribe must not assist the student in making decisions during the editing process.

Scribe responses on the ELA test, using speech-to-text or other external augmentative communications device (other than a smartphone) used by student to dictate or generate responses, under the direct supervision of a test administrator. The student may make edits independently or may direct the scribe to make the edits. The scribe must not assist the student in making decisions during the editing process.

reference-code.code: SA4 Calculation Device on Non-Calc Test

custom-fields.custom-field: Calculation device or other mathematics tool (e.g., addition/subtraction or multiplication/division tables; or manipulatives) on the non-calculator session of the Mathematics test.

Spell-checker for the ELA test, including an external spell-checking device for the paper-based test; or in conjunction with the typed response accommodation for the paper-based test. The student may not use grammar check or access the internet.

Word prediction for the ELA test, using an external device, application, or software compatible with the computer based test platform. Word prediction external device provides a bank of frequently or recently used words after the student keyboards the first few letters of a word.

reference-code.description: Scribing the Writing Test (only for students requiring special consideration)
Allow short, supervised breaks during testing
Administer the test to a small group in a separate location

reference-code.code: Spell Check or Ext Spell Check Device
Student dictates responses to school personnel
reference-code.description: Student dictates constructed responses or observations to school personnel

reference-code.code: Student dictates responses using assistive tech.
reference-code.description: Student dictates constructed responses or observations using assistive technology

reference-code.description: Student hand writes responses on separate paper (personnel transcribes in Answer Booklet)

reference-code.code: Student reads test and directions aloud to self
reference-code.description: Student reads test and directions aloud to self
Student writes using brailler (personnel transcribes into Answer Booklet)
with time to complete a session extended beyond the scheduled administration time within the same da
so that only a portion of the test session was administered on a particular day.
at the time of day or day of week that takes into account the student's medical needs or learning st

reference-code.code: Test and directions read aloud to student
reference-code.description: Test and directions read aloud to student (Math, Science, and Writing only)

custom-fields.custom-field: Assistance from a test administrator regarding the use of the computer-based testing platform.

reference-code.code: Text-to-Speech or Video of Human Interpreter
reference-code.description: Text-to-Speech or Video of Human Interpreter for ELA/Lit Assess, items, response options, passages
Administer the test at the time of day that takes into account the student's medical needs
Translation dictionary, non-electronic with no definitions (ELL students in Math, Science, Writing)

custom-fields.custom-field:
Computer-Based Testing Highlight Tool
Paper-Based Testing (Used in test booklets, not answer booklets, by students in grades 4-8; colored pencils may be used by students in grade 3.)

Test administrator reads aloud (or signs, in the case of a student who is Deaf or Hard-of-Hearing) selected words on the Mathematics tests, as requested by the student. The student will point to the word or phrase that he or she needs read aloud or signed. Test administrator quietly reads aloud or signs the selected word to the student. Students using this feature may be tested alongside other students in groups of any size.

reference-code.code: UF11 Test Admin Redirects Student Attention

custom-fields.custom-field: Test administrator redirects student's attention to the test without coaching or assisting the student to answer any questions (e.g., test administrator reminds student to stay focused; it is not permissible to say, "Add more to your response" or "Make sure to answer all questions.")

reference-code.code: UF12 Read Aloud, Repeat, Clarify Test Directions
reference-code.description: Read Aloud, Repeat, Clarify Test Directions, as needed

reference-code.code: UF2 Alt Background and Font Color

custom-fields.custom-field:
Computer-Based Testing Alternative background and font color; adjust contrast; use tinted lens(es) The student can select a predefined color combination for text and background (i.e., black on cream, black on light blue, black on light magenta, white on black, and light blue on dark blue).
Paper-Based Testing Use colored overlays or tinted lens(es)

Computer-Based Testing Magnifier tool or Zoom tool Magnifier tool enlarges part of the screen; Zoom tool enlarges or reduces entire screen by pressing Ctrl + or Ctrl -.
Paper-Based Testing Magnification tool or device/low-vision aid

Computer-Based Testing Line reader tool Masks text so only part of the text can be viewed at one time
Paper-Based Testing Tracking device, such as a straight edge or similar tool

Computer-Based Testing Answer masking Lets you choose which answer choices will show on the screen.
Paper-Based Testing Mask text or answer(s) using a blank card or cutout

Computer-Based Testing Answer eliminator Student marks "X" through each answer option they think is incorrect
Paper-Based Testing Use a pencil to eliminate answer choices in test booklet

Computer-Based Test Audio aids (e.g., volume control, amplification device, or white noise machine, provided a smartphone is not used)
Paper-Based Test Audio aids (e.g., amplification device or white noise machine, provided a smart phone is not used)

reference-code.code: Word prediction on ELA/Lit Perf-Based Assessment
reference-code.description: Word prediction on the ELA/Literacy Performance-Based Assessment

reference-code.code: Write w/ word processor, typewriter, or computer
reference-code.description: Student writes using word processor, typewriter, computer (personnel transcribes in Answer Booklet)
